titles.title: Government Printing Office Electronic Information Access Enhancement Act of 1993
Government Printing Office Electronic Information Access Enhancement Act of 1993
A bill to establish in the Government Printing Office a means of enhancing electronic public access to a wide range of Federal electronic information.

action.text: Sponsor introductory remarks on measure. (CR S2781)
Read twice and referred to the Committee on Rules.

calendar.text: Committee on Rules. Ordered to be reported without amendment favorably.

action.text: Committee on Rules. Reported to Senate by Senator Ford without amendment. With written report No. 103-27.

calendar.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 40.

vote.text: Passed Senate without amendment by Voice Vote.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on House Administration.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

calendar.text: Ordered to be Reported by Voice Vote.

action.text: Reported by the Committee on House Administration. H. Rept. 103-108.

calendar.text: Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 56.

action.text: Mr. Kleczka moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: 3/11/1993--Introduced. Government Printing Office Electronic Information Access Enhancement Act of 1993 - Requires the Superintendant of Documents, under the direction of the Public Printer, to establish a means for providing the public with online access to electronic public information of the Federal Government. Sets forth guidelines for determining fees for accessing such information. Permits depository libraries to access information through such means without charge. Requires the Public Printer to report to the Congress on the savings resulting from such online public access to Government information and on the status of the system providing such access.
